intro: Sanicula triclinium, commonly known as the three-bed sanicula, is a perennial herb native to the United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sanicula triclinium has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that attract pollinators.
